snippet: Mexico’s foreign minister flew to Egypt on Tuesday to demand answers about an airstrike over the weekend that hit a picnic full of Mexican tourists, killing a dozen people.
abstract: Mexican Foreign Min Claudia Ruiz Massieu travels to Egypt demanding information about military airstrike on group of Mexican tourists picnicking in desert; Egyptian authorities express condolences for deaths, but reject criticism from human rights advocates that country's military acts indiscriminately against perceived threats and has no clear rules of engagement.

byline.contributor: Merna Thomas contributed reporting from Cairo, and Elisabeth Malkin from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: Mexico’s foreign minister flew to Egypt on Tuesday to demand answers about an airstrike over the weekend that hit a picnic full of Mexican tourists, killing a dozen people.

headline.main: Egypt Rejects Criticism Over Airstrike That Killed Mexican Tourists
headline.print_headline: Egypt Rejects Criticism Over Airstrike That Killed Mexican Tourists
